page.title: 03Traffic survey
page.content: The main road (30 mph zone) through Sywell goes from Northampton to Kettering. We carried out a traffic survey to see how busy it was. Lorries are banned along the main road except for those that are delivering to the shop and the school. The morning is the busiest time of the day, with the greatest number of cars. The number of vehicles was counted in the morning, dinner time and in the afternoon. No tractors were seen though they often travel from farm to farm along this road and no buses were observed but United Counties run daily to Kettering, Corby, Old and Northampton. Only three bikes were seen during the survey. Only eight pedestrians were seen at the different survey times. Three were shopping and five were walking their dogs. People on horseback are usually a common sight.
